Don't settle for the basics.

Social media platforms just rely on a basic profanity filter and a list of bad words.

Works only in English

The profanity filter of both platforms works just in English, no other languages.

No creative spelling

Native filters will detect normal spelling, but not "fck ff lrdy" or "fck Off 4lr34dy".

Just a pre-defined list

Many bad statements will not include your specifically blacklisted bad words.

Leverage machine learning to keep your comments clean

Comments that trigger your filters will be hidden within seconds of being posted.

Hide toxicity

Automatically hide comments that readers will perceive as toxic (rude, disrespectful, abusive or unreasonable).

Profanity

Automatically hide comments that contain profane language, including even the most creative spelling.

URLs

Automatically hide comments that contain spammy URLs that try to hijack your ad and lure people away.

Images

Automatically hide comments that contain images, videos or GIFs, which are often used to circumvent moderation.

Emojis

Automatically hide comments that contain emojis. You can choose to hide all emojis or select just specific emojis.

Keywords

Automatically hide comments that contain specific words, like for example the names of your competitors.
